Sentencas: The formation of carbon is a problem when operating solid-oxide fuel cells (SOFC) containing nickel/yttria-stabilized zirconia (Ni/YSZ) anodes with hydrocarbon fuels directly.
Titulo: Effect of anodic polarization on carbon deposition on Ni/YSZ anodes exposed to methane

Sentencas: Previous studies have examined the carbon formed ex-situ on Ni/YSZ anodes.
Titulo: Effect of anodic polarization on carbon deposition on Ni/YSZ anodes exposed to methane

Sentencas: In this study, we have examined the carbon formed in-situ under operating conditions, and investigated the effects of current density, time, and anode thickness on both the amount and type of carbon formed at 1073 K using temperature programmed oxidation and scanning electron microscopy.
Titulo: Effect of anodic polarization on carbon deposition on Ni/YSZ anodes exposed to methane

Sentencas: The carbon formed under operating conditions was more reactive and contained hydrogen compared to the carbon formed at open circuit potential that did not contain hydrogen.
Titulo: Effect of anodic polarization on carbon deposition on Ni/YSZ anodes exposed to methane

Sentencas: When the current density was increased less carbon was deposited, but the characteristics of the carbon did not change.
Titulo: Effect of anodic polarization on carbon deposition on Ni/YSZ anodes exposed to methane

Sentencas: With increasing time and/or anode thickness, the carbon deposits became more difficult to remove and decreased in hydrogen content.
Titulo: Effect of anodic polarization on carbon deposition on Ni/YSZ anodes exposed to methane
Effect of anodic polarization on carbon deposition on Ni/YSZ anodes exposed to methane
